@peterjc123
If you call __getattribute__ once before getattr , you can end up in infinite recursions very easily. So, the following codes can run correctly.

def __getattr__(self, name):
    object.__getattribute__(self, 'conn') #insert here
    return getattr(self.conn, name)

or

if 'conn' in self.__dict__:
    return getattr(self.conn, name)
